title: Problem setting up in a Cray system
body:
I've tried using spack like described in the getting started, and I'm getting the error `configure: error: installation or configuration problem: C compiler cannot create executables.` The full error message I got in `build.out` is:
```
==> '/ufs/home/eates/spack/var/spack/stage/libelf-0.8.13-dabkko6td6l6fr5lzsvyiengzkcsqrfx/libelf-0.8.13/configure' '--prefix=/ufs/home/eates/spack/opt/spack/c
ray-CNL-ivybridge/gcc-4.8.0/libelf-0.8.13-dabkko6td6l6fr5lzsvyiengzkcsqrfx' '--enable-shared' '--disable-dependency-tracking' '--disable-debug'
creating cache ./config.cache
checking whether make sets ${MAKE}... yes
checking for gcc... /ufs/home/eates/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc
checking whether the C compiler (/ufs/home/eates/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc  ) works... no
configure: error: installation or configuration problem: C compiler cannot create executables.
```

Afterwards, I tried setting `compilers.yaml` and `packages.yaml` to these:
```
eates@system:~> cat ~/.spack/compilers.yaml 
compilers:
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: 
        - 'PrgEnv-cray'
        - 'cce/8.5.6'
    operating_system: CNL
    spec: 'cce@8.5.6'
    paths:
        cc: cc
        cxx: CC
        f77: ftn
        fc: ftn
    target: any
```
```eates@system:~> cat ~/.spack/packages.yaml 
packages:
    mpich:
        modules: 
            cray-mpich@7.5.1%cce@8.5.6 arch=cray-CNL-ivybridge: cray-mpich/7.5.1
        buildable: False
    all:
        compiler: [cce@8.5.6]
        providers:
            mpi: [mpich@7.5.1]
```
and the error I'm getting is very similar:
```
==> '/ufs/home/eates/spack/var/spack/stage/libelf-0.8.13-hmy3w4e2ce5bq64fs2rbdm3cukmoe2mv/libelf-0.8.13/configure' '--prefix=/ufs/home/eates/spack/opt/spack/cray-CNL-ivybridge/cce-8.5.6/libelf-0.8.13-hmy3w4e2ce5bq64fs2rbdm3cukmoe2mv' '--enable-shared' '--disable-dependency-tracking' '--disable-debug'
loading cache ./config.cache
checking whether make sets ${MAKE}... yes
checking for gcc... /ufs/home/eates/spack/lib/spack/env/cc
checking whether the C compiler (/ufs/home/eates/spack/lib/spack/env/cc  ) works... no
configure: error: installation or configuration problem: C compiler cannot create executables.
```
I can run `configure` on some other tarballs that I download when the `$PATH` is correctly set, and I don't really understand what's going wrong with the configure that spack is running. I can't use `~/spack/lib/spack/env/cc` from the terminal, and I ran out of ideas. I've also tried setting `paths` to whole paths as I saw in some other issue here, but that didn't solve the issue.
